newsitem.title: USA: Pinnacle to buy miro Video Products group.
newsitem.headline: Pinnacle to buy miro Video Products group.

text.p: Pinnacle Systems Inc said it signed a letter of intent to acquire the miro Digital Video Products group from miro Computer Products AG, Braunschweig, Germany, for about $21 million, excluding transaction and integration costs.
Pinnacle said it anticipates it will acquire the assets of the miro Digital Video Products group, including the miroVIDEO and miroMOTION product lines, certain technology, and other assets.
Pinnacle said it will pay about $15 million in cash, $5 million in Pinnacle Systems Common stock, and assume liabilities of approximately $1 million.
The company said it also expects to incur about $1 million in costs associated with executing the transaction and integrating the businesses.

The company said it anticipates that a significant portion of the purchase price will be charged as in-process research and development and other non-recurring costs in the quarter ending September 30, 1997.
